Node.definition: = the meaning of this word is uncertain and can only be deduced from its etymology; possible interpretations include: a song that shows understanding, by which the understanding either refers to the structure or to the contents of this song; or: a song that gives understanding; or: a meditation
= man; ◄ son of Berechiah (בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► temple singer; time of king David (דָּוִד)
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
literally: to bend (one's) ear; hence: = action by which humans or deities make a conscious effort to listen to what (other) humans say
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: (to cause) to bubble up > to pour out
Node.definition: literally: to cause to bubble up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter many words
= action by which humans or deities utter words that are often compacted and well formulated and that require wisdom to be understood
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= indirect male progenitor

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= causative action by which humans refrain from sharing information with others
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= a deed that merits appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which deities have the ability to perform powerful acts
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= indirect male progenitor

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state where humans feel confident◄ due to their reliance on God or something else for protection
= an activity performed by a person or deity
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= indirect male progenitor
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= state by which humans or animals stand up to or oppose the authority of a person or ruler or deity
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
literally: to be established; hence: = state in which someone's heart (לֵב) or spirit (רוּחַ) is committed to following the will of God
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to be faithful|to be reliable|to be trustworthy|to be true
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of Joseph (יֹוסֵף) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
exact meaning uncertain; possibly: = state in which a person is equipped with a weapon, especially a bow and arrows
literally: hurlers of bow; = a soldiers who are specialized in fighting with bow and arrows
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= armed conflict in which weapons are used to attack an enemy
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= an activity performed by a person or deity
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes
= indirect male progenitor

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= town; ◄ located in Nile (יְאֹר) delta of Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) ► Egyptian capital during 21st and 22nd dynasties; administrative centre of Lower Egypt

Node.gloss: to split|to cleave|to rip open|to cut|to rend|to maul|to divide|to break through
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or human cause an object to split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

Node.gloss: to cause to stand|to set (up)|to put|to place
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a person, animal or inanimate object to be in a certain location, usually in an upright position
= a large quantity of water, staying together as one heap as if it were a solid substance
= a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity
= during the daytime
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

Node.gloss: to split|to cleave|to rip open|to cut|to rend|to maul|to divide|to break through
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or human cause an object to split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence
= mass of rock projecting and forming an elevation
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity

Node.gloss: to bring out|to cause to flow
Node.definition: literally: to bring out (of a certain place); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause liquids to flow from a certain place

Node.gloss: to let flow down|to let run down|to let stream down
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause bodies of water to flow from a higher elevation to a lower elevation
= flowing body of water
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions; ≈ associated with thirst and hardship
literally: to put (a deity) to the test; = action by which humans are disobedient towards deities in spite of the possibility that they might provoke them to anger
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= mass of rock projecting and forming an elevation
= process whereb liquids move freely as in a stream
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical

Node.gloss: to prepare|to make ready|to make provisions (for something)
Node.definition: = causative action where humans or deities make objects ready for use
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
literally: to come up; hence: = process by which an activity increases in intensity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= something that provides or prevents access ◄ as if it were a door

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
literally: to send rain; hence: = causative action by which deities cause objects to fall from the sky ◄ like rain

= substance described as falling from heaven to feed the Israelites in the desert, sometimes identified with the honeylike liquid dropping from tamarisk trees; its name is associated with the interrogative pronoun meaning what (is it)?
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= supernatural being
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= various foodstuffs, ► harvested, produced, or caught for human consumption
= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= causative action by which deities cause a wind to blow

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= wind, ◄ emanating from the south
literally: to send rain; hence: = causative action by which deities cause objects to fall from the sky ◄ like rain
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection
= causative process by which humans cause (other) humans and objects to move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= temporary construction ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, shepherds, etc.
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= process by which someone senses a physical craving for food
literally: to become dissociated from an action; hence: = to stop being actively engaged in a process
= process by which someone senses a physical craving for food
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to come up; hence: = process by which an activity increases in intensity
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to cause to go down on (their) knees; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause their enemies to be struck down in battle, collapse and die
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help

Node.gloss: to cause (someone's) else to spend (their) days
Node.definition: literally: to finish (someone's) days; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans go through the motions of life for a particular amount of time
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which humans experience a state of great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such as trembling and pain
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
literally: to come back; hence: = action by which humans reengage in an activity that they had been engaging in before
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
figurative extension of a rock as place of refuge: = deity that protects and provides refuge
= a biblical title for the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

Node.gloss: to lure|to allure|to entice|to coax|to persuade|to seduce|to flatter|to trick|to deceive
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities provoke in (other) humans the will or desire to do something
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to be established; hence: = state in which someone's heart (לֵב) or spirit (רוּחַ) is committed to following the will of God

Node.gloss: to be faithful|to be reliable|to be trustworthy|to be true
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state in which deities feel compassion for humans, ► which is usually translated into action
= action by which deities do not hold wrongdoers any longer responsible for certain actions, often as a result of an atonement ritual or a change in behavior of the guilty party
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = action by which deities cause a condition in which they are personally involved to come to an end
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

Node.gloss: to rouse|to stir up|to raise|to stoke
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes an event to start taking place, ◄ as if it had been dormant or inactive for a certain time
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
literally: to turn; hence: = process by which objects move back into the direction they came from

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

Node.gloss: to be grieved|to be distressed|to be in pain
Node.definition: = state of being emotionally hurt or troubled
= area without water and therefore without vegetation and settlers; sometimes taken as the name of one specific region
literally: to put (a deity) to the test; = action by which humans are disobedient towards deities in spite of the possibility that they might provoke them to anger
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which someone causes someone else to experience displeasure and pain ◄ through words or actions

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= supernatural act of a deity, ◄ performed by the deity himself or in his name; ►in order to assert his power and greatness
= supernatural act of a deity, ◄ performed by the deity himself or in his name; ►in order to assert his power and greatness

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= town; ◄ located in Nile (יְאֹר) delta of Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) ► Egyptian capital during 21st and 22nd dynasties; administrative centre of Lower Egypt
= causative process by which humans, deities, or forces give (other) humans or objects a different nature, character, or form

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
= a body of water flowing to and from the Nile river, whether in the form of a manmade canal or a subsidiary river branch, especially those of the Nile delta region
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= causative action by which deities commission one or more people to go to a certain individual or place to inflict punishment
literally: mixture; possibly a general term for a large group of insects
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= amphibious small animal with large hind legs used for jumping; about 70 mm. long; brown or olive green in color; lays eggs which hatch as tadpoles and gradually grow legs; ◄ Edible Frog (|iRana esculenta|i*) or Spotted Frog (|iRana punctata|i*); ► unclean; ≈ associated with demons by Egyptians and Persians
exact meaning unkown; probably: = juvenile form of locust (אַרְבֶּה)
= general term for plants that are sources of food; ≈ a sign of God's blessing
= action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

= six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness

= a tree up to 10 m high with large low, spreading branches; its fruit grows in bunches on the trunk and branches of the tree rather than among the leaves; ◄ Ficus sycomorus; ► its fruit is edible but not as juicy or sweet as the more common variety of fig; ≈ image of something plentiful

meaning not entirely clear; among the possibilities are: = (a) heavy rains resulting in a destructive flood ; (b) state of extreme cold, destructive to certain kinds of trees and other vegetation ; (c) snow or hail melting while falling
= causative action of controling and restricting movement; that is, to hand over a person or an object to another's control
= pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction
collective: = animals that have been domesticated
= a sudden burst of brighly glowing light, whose source can be seen (like fire) or invisible (like lightning)

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
literally: kindling of anger; hence: = process by which the anger (אַף) of deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= causative action by which humans or deities keep (other) humans from performing a particular event
= process by which humans or animals stop living

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= always occurs parallel to נֶפֶשׁ ; literally: (someone's) life, though used in such a way that that life represents the entire person who owns it
in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God
= causative action of controling and restricting movement; that is, to hand over a person or an object to another's control
= first offspring of any female; ► in the case of humans, the main heir of estate and blessing
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= nation; another name for Egypt (מִצְרַיִם)

Node.gloss: to cause to depart|to lead out|to drive out
Node.definition: literally to make (someone) pluck up (their tent pegs); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a relatively large company of humans, together with their possessions, to depart from a place where they had set up a temporary residence

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= an area dominated by elevations of the earth's surface

Node.gloss: to acquire|to obtain|to purchase|to buy|to reclaim
Node.definition: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
literally: to cause (something) to fall (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause land to become someone else's property

= piece of stout cord; ◄ made by twisting together palm fibres, linen, or reeds; ► used for tying and keeping things together, climbing, measuring, drawing things to oneself, making traps, etc.; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to conditions that try to take control of people; a rope tied around the head is a symbol of submission
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to put (a deity) to the test; = action by which humans are disobedient towards deities in spite of the possibility that they might provoke them to anger
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= indirect male progenitor
= process by which humans, deities, or objects take on a different nature, character, or form
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
literally: a slack bow; hence: = a bow that has lost its spring and is therefore no longer useful

Node.gloss: to trouble|to vex|to provoke to anger
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans or deities to experience displeasure ◄ by their words or behavior
= place of worship, often situated in an elevated location, but not necessarily so
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= process by which humans and deities provoke in someone else a sentiment of anger ◄ by lavishing one's attention on someone else rather than on that person
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= temporary construction ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, shepherds, etc.
= town; ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► location of Tent of Meeting for some time
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which people, animals or objects have been forcibly carried off; ► in the case of people, into slavery or exile
literally: strength; hence: = a group of people that have come into existence and are being kept safe by someone's strength
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= causative action of controling and restricting movement; that is, to hand over a person or an object to another's control
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
literally: to wake up; hence: = action by which humans or deities who had been refraining from action start to engage themselves, ◄ as if waking up from sleep
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with death, sometimes with being inactive
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= people living in a certain home or larger area, usually with a common ancestor
= man; ◄ eleventh son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and first son of Rachel (רָחֵל) ► father of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) and Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה) each founder of a tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of Joseph (יֹוסֵף) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
literally: high (places); hence: = a reference to God's dwelling place in heaven
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to found; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities bring something into existence
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= area enclosed by a stone wall or hedge made of branches and thorns, with a narrow opening which can be closed with brush or by the shepherd’s body; ► used for keeping sheep at night to protect them from thieves or wild animals

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

literally: palm of the hand, but used in a figurative sense with the focus on the activities that are performed with one's hands; = someone's actions, whether or not performed with one's hands, for which one is personally responsible
